CssProperty.name: text-rendering
CssProperty.description: The creator of SVG content might want to provide a hint to the implementation about what tradeoffs to make as it renders text. The ‘text-rendering’ property provides these hints.

CssProperty.name: image-rendering
CssProperty.description: The creator of SVG content might want to provide a hint to the implementation about how to make speed vs. quality tradeoffs as it performs image processing. The ‘image-rendering’ property provides a hint to the SVG user agent about how to optimize its image rendering.

CssProperty.name: color-rendering
CssProperty.description: The creator of SVG content might want to provide a hint to the implementation about how to make speed vs. quality tradeoffs as it performs color interpolation and compositing. The ‘color-rendering’ property provides a hint to the SVG user agent about how to optimize its color interpolation and compositing operations.

CssProperty.name: shape-rendering
CssProperty.description: The creator of SVG content might want to provide a hint to the implementation about what tradeoffs to make as it renders vector graphics elements such as ‘path’ elements and basic shapes such as circles and rectangles.

CssProperty.name: fill
CssProperty.description: The 'fill' property paints the interior of the given graphical element.

CssProperty.name: fill-rule
CssProperty.description: The 'fill-rule' property indicates the algorithm which is to be used to determine what parts of the canvas are included inside the shape.

CssProperty.name: fill-opacity
CssProperty.description: 'fill-opacity' specifies the opacity of the painting operation used to paint the interior the current object.

CssProperty.name: stroke
CssProperty.description: The 'stroke' property paints along the outline of the given graphical element.

CssProperty.name: stroke-width
CssProperty.description: This property specifies the width of the stroke on the current object.

CssProperty.name: stroke-linecap
CssProperty.description: Specifies the shape to be used at the end of open subpaths when they are stroked.

CssProperty.name: stroke-linejoin
CssProperty.description: specifies the shape to be used at the corners of paths or basic shapes when they are stroked.

CssProperty.name: stroke-miterlimit
CssProperty.description: When two line segments meet at a sharp angle and miter joins have been specified for 'stroke-linejoin', it is possible for the miter to extend far beyond the thickness of the line stroking the path.

CssProperty.name: stroke-dasharray
CssProperty.description: Controls the pattern of dashes and gaps used to stroke paths.

CssProperty.name: stroke-dashoffset
CssProperty.description: Specifies the distance into the dash pattern to start the dash.

CssProperty.name: stroke-opacity
CssProperty.description: Specifies the opacity of the painting operation used to stroke the current object.

CssProperty.name: marker-side
CssProperty.description: Specifies if list item markers position themselves relative to the list item or the list container’s directionality.

CssProperty.name: marker-start
CssProperty.description: Defines the arrowhead or polymarker that shall be drawn at the first vertex of the given ‘path’ element or basic shape.

CssProperty.name: marker-end
CssProperty.description: Defines the arrowhead or polymarker that shall be drawn at the final vertex.

CssProperty.name: marker-mid
CssProperty.description: Defines the arrowhead or polymarker that shall be drawn at every other vertex.

CssProperty.name: marker
CssProperty.description: Specifies the marker symbol that shall be used for all points on the sets the value for all vertices on the given ‘path’ element or basic shape.

CssProperty.name: color-interpolation
CssProperty.description: Specifies the color space for gradient interpolations, color animations and alpha compositing.

CssProperty.name: color-interpolation-filters
CssProperty.description: Specifies the color space for imaging operations performed via filter effects.

CssProperty.name: text-anchor
CssProperty.description: Used to align (start-, middle- or end-alignment) a string of text relative to a given point.

CssProperty.name: paint-order
CssProperty.description: Controls the order that the three paint operations that shapes and text are rendered with: their fill, their stroke and any markers they might have.
